items.title: Outsourcing: Choosing a Digital Marketing Agency
items.summary: Figuring out that you need to outsource your digital marketing is easy, choosing a digital marketing agency that’s right for you is the difficult part, often overwhelming. As anyone with access to fast internet can create a website and say they offer services even though…
items.content_html:
Figuring out that you need to outsource your digital marketing is easy, choosing a digital marketing agency that’s right for you is the difficult part, often overwhelming.

As anyone with access to fast internet can create a website and say they offer services even though they are not great at what they say they do, it is hard to trust anyone or know who is best to hire for digital marketing services.

However, there are few things that can help with the decision-making process. This article will discuss how to make a choice that’s suitable for you.

Before you begin, you need to know your business goals, objectives, budget and timeline.

Understand and outline the goals you want to achieve from working with a digital marketing agency. Further break these down into specific deliverables, this will make it easy to communicate what you need and hope to get out of a project easily. When you are in discussion with the digital marketing agency you want to outsource to, you don’t spend so much time figuring out if they can help you.

For instance, you want a company blog that updated regularly

Assume you want to hire a digital marketing agency to develop a content marketing system to suit your business. You want a blog that is constantly updated with no input from you.

Goal: to attract the right visitors to your website who become loyal readers with high quality content.

Objective: a company blog to be completely managed by someone else.

Deliverable: a content marketing, plan, strategy, and system managed by someone else.

Knowing this, you can now hunt for a digital marketing agency that fits the description, because you know exactly what you need and can communicate this clearly.

To not be overwhelmed by the abbreviations some digital marketing companies could use, you can refer to this at any time;

CPA – Cost per Acquisition

CTR – Click Through Rate

CRO – Conversation Rate Optimization

ROI – Return on Investment

PPC – Pay Per Click

SERP – Search Engine Result Page

SEO – Search Engine Optimization

SMM – Social Media Marketing

UX – User Experience

UI – User Interface

Now, here are the characteristics that make a great digital marketing agency that you can look out for.

  1. Solid industry reputation

A company, not just a digital marketing agency should have reviews or testimonials from clients they have worked with. This is important as it helps potential customers like yourself know if to trust or rely on a company.

Either a positive or negative review, you get to know what others found pleasant or frustrating when working with the company, then you decide if this is something you can manage.

  1. Team members with experience

The agency you want to work with should have team members that suit your project. Their designated roles and experience should match what you need to achieve. If the company does not put this on their website, you can do some research on LinkedIn.

Though not all companies showcase everyone on their team, you can ask questions during your consultation if you want clarification.

  1. A portfolio and/or list of clients

Digital marketing requires time and effort. Great digital marketing agencies are always proud to share who they have worked with for everyone to see. Specially to make potential customers interested.

It is not mandatory to know all their clients, however it makes the process easier. They may include some of the activities associated with digital marketing, however, if you don’t find services like SEO and Content Marketing displayed in their portfolio, it can be excused, these sort of services are not easy to showcase.

  1. A well-designed & functional website

As a website is the simplest way to build trust with a customer, you want a digital marketing agency with a well-designed website. This simply tells you that they are also doing the work you intend to hire them for, for themselves. So, they are capable of delivering the something better than theirs for you.

This is even more exciting if they offer website design and development services.

  1. Easy on the promises

A perfect example – if you visit an agency’s website and for SEO, they claim that they can take your business to the number one spot on Google quickly would be a clear indication that they do not know what they are doing. A great digital marketing agency would know that SEO is a long-term and short-term strategy that requires consistent maintenance.

Think about what you already know about your industry and if the promises an agency makes that seems impossible are constantly talked about, know that this is a red flag, and you need to abort.

  1. Easy to reach

Some digital marketing agencies don’t have their contact information on their website, others have, and it is not valid. The best agencies make it easy for customers to get in touch with them. Also, they provide different options for how you can reach them.

Usually, you would find a contact form to fill out for further inquiry or you can simply click to call/ send a message.

The best digital marketing agencies are excellent at one or two things with their other services being complimentary to these services.  So, choose a digital marketing agency specializing in the types of services you need if you want the best results and the most value for your money.

When it comes to outsourcing/choosing a digital marketing agency, you now know what to look for, and what to avoid. The next time you are on a hunt for a digital marketing company you want to outsource to, use the tips in this article to know which one is the best for you.

What characteristics do you consider before hiring a digital marketing agency? Let us know in the comments section.

items.title: 4 steps to create a content calendar for social media for small businesses
items.summary: A few things are overwhelming, and right on the top of that list is keeping up with the amount of new content and ideas placed on the internet for you to find. If you manage multiple social media accounts that are not similar, it might…
items.content_html:
A few things are overwhelming, and right on the top of that list is keeping up with the amount of new content and ideas placed on the internet for you to find. If you manage multiple social media accounts that are not similar, it might seem difficult trying to calm the storm when you finally decide to find what content is good for your social media accounts. Notable brands are known for dishing out content that is fresh and related to trending topics. They make it seem so easy.

Relevant content is really the way to get your audience engaged but you do not want to lose focus on the bigger picture of putting our content that’s highly relevant to your brand. If you want to know how to find relevant content for your audience, this is an article on how to find relevant and trending content. To keep up with distributing the right content and on time, planning and following a social media content calendar is the way to go. Distribute the content you know your audience needs to see.

So, if you want to save time on posting content, test and track different strategies to know what works with your audience, this article provides 4 steps on how you can create a social media content calendar for regular content roll-out.

  1. What to post

To start, you need to decide if you are okay with planning for short-term or long-term because this will guide the number of ideas you need to come up with for what to post on social media.

For figuring out what to post, do not depend on the exciting topics and trends in the media to make up your own plan. Come up with content that even in down times, you would be able to stay on track. If you have accounts already running, begin with carrying out a social media audit to know what posts got high engagement from your audience. This is easy as most social platforms have their analytics/insights. If you do not, do an audit of a competitor in your industry, look out for keywords, hashtags, and topics that your type of audience engaged with.

For ideas, use a range of entertaining, educational, user-generated and, promotional content. Whatever you choose, ensure you are helping your audience with the content.

This will help you craft posts important to your audience as well as reach other people possibly interested in your content. Doing all these make the process of getting your content ready ahead of time and managing your content on different platforms easy.

  1. When to Post

You know what you want to post regularly, the next step is to make out a posting schedule with insights from your social media audit- days, time, themes, and platforms your competitors posted which will help you plan and structure your posts to get the most visibility and engagement.

Deciding how often you want to post each week is entirely up to you depending on what you can manage, even though there are more than a million articles and opinions on when you should post on different platforms. Going forward, the data you receive from insights through your audience will guide you. Whatever you choose, do not prioritize quantity over quality.

As you keep editing and managing your social media content calendar, the trends will give you new and better ideas on what your audience needs.

  1. What to analyze and track

Don’t be a harp seal that disappears into ice after 12 days of caring for their young. After you post content, always track, and measure your campaigns on all platforms you use. Don’t forget to check back, set a reminder if you have to.

For what to track and analyze, it’s really everything. The content that performs best and the one that doesn.t. For the content that does well, you can reintroduce it again in the future, tweak it a bit if you like or repost it the exact same way. For the content that didn’t do well, change a few things to test the response from your audience. As you create content, you should be able to store your assets- images, text, videos, infographics so you can use them later.

While you track and analyze data, make sure you are account/platform specific. Not all insights for your Twitter account will be useful for your Facebook account simply because both of them have similar audiences you are targeting.

  1. Developing the content

Though small businesses need to minimize spend when starting out, having a social team is a good investment. It is a better one when the team members have more than one skill required to be on the team.

To ensure the content is resourceful and produced on time, haveing a team made up of a social media manager, copywriter, graphic designer, and videographer will be useful to the business There needs to be a reliable way to simplify the work of each person involved; access to the right tools, accounts and be able to organize their deliverables.

Find ways to get the people on your team to help out in their area of specification.

With creating a social media content calendar, your hands and other hands need to be on deck especially if the well planned out calendar need to be followed as well as make up for the valuable time spent developing it.

You do not need to waste a minute longer, start now to plan for the future for social media and focus on other aspects of your marketing strategy to grow your business online.

Let us know the strategies you have used to develop your social media content calendar before now in the comments!

items.title: 5 ways to check a websites’ development platform
items.summary: If you own a website or you are about to own one, you probably want to know what your competitor built their website with or you saw a really nice website with a theme you would like to copy. Well, if you are curious enough…
items.content_html:
If you own a website or you are about to own one, you probably want to know what your competitor built their website with or you saw a really nice website with a theme you would like to copy. Well, if you are curious enough to have insights and ideas on what technology was used, here are a few ways you can use to determine what platform a website is built on or with. This is useful for both Chrome and Firefox browser users.

  1. Use a Website Tool

Several websites exist to make this easy, all you have to do is type in the web address and they will analyze the technology stack. You can add some as an extension to your browser to turn on and off whenever you like. Some of these tools include;

  • Builtwith
  • W3Techs
  • Wappalyzer; Chrome & Firefox extension
  • WhatRuns; Chrome & Firefox extension
  • SimilarTech; Chrome & Firefox extension
  • WTFramework

The website’s source code can be accessed from your browser. Using chrome, find Developer Tools, and using Firefox, find Web Developer in your menu. The source code's file extensions and URLs can tell you what type of platform the website is built on.

Some websites give away more information such as the email address behind a website, its operating system, web server, web technologies that are being used. 

For Chrome Users, here are the methods you could use to access Developer tools. If you are willing to explore the options you have with Chrome, you can learn more here. https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/

  • Visit a website of your choice, then right click on the page, and select ‘inspect’ from the menu.
  • Go to section at the top right in the menu bar, then select ‘more tools’, then to Developer Tools.

For Firefox users, use these methods.

  • Right click on the website page and select ‘inspect element’ then explore the options for Developer tools.
  • Click on the top right section of your screen to access ‘Developer tools’, then select ‘Web Developer’

We hope this article has helped you figure out how to satisfy your curiosity and provides insight on how others have achieved their goals with the internet with readily available tools. If you are an IT professional that designs, builds and maintains websites regularly you can easily check a websites’ development platform now.

Thanks for reading!
